strings.Value: "Valerie, I just want to say, your loyalty means a lot to me."
"We have to go. I know I don't even need to ask if you're ready."
"Even if I fall in battle, I'll die happy. I had the finest woman in the world at my side!"

{n}Valerie looks determined and focused. Her eyes shine with a special light.{/n} "I'm just waiting for a signal to attack. There's a great battle ahead, and it will end with a great victory. I believe that more than I've ever believed anything."

{n}Valerie sighs quite heartily and looks down for a moment.{/n} "I'm glad to hear it. I would never turn away from my duty, no matter what. Yet it's better to enter a dangerous battle with an easy heart — knowing that your sword serves one who truly values your loyalty."
"Every failure. Every fallen comrade. But these regrets cannot undermine my spirit. We learn from our mistakes and harden for times like these."
"And I need not answer. To arms! We will protect this land and free you from this curse. That's why I've taken up my weapons. And I won't put them down until all our plans are fulfilled."
{n}A smile blossoms on Valerie's lips when she sees you.{/n} "I'm waiting for your signal, my king. Together to the end of the world — remember?"

{n}Valerie rolls her eyes jokingly.{/n} "Has the imminence of the final battle made you a poet? I hope not!" {n}Valerie leans forward and kisses you.{/n} "We will come back alive. You and I. And we'll be happy. If I like anything about ballads, it's a good ending. Now let's see this story through!"
"I'll follow you to Hell and to the Abyss. Lead us, my king!"
